years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time
pros:
One of the fastest (if not fastest) stacks in HFT.
Good work/life balance. Relaxed atmosphere.
cons: Relatively low risk appetite when trading.

review_title: Mixed bag where the pros outweigh the cons
years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time for more than a year
pros: -Junior people are generally honest, friendly, and extremely smart -Some really exceptional managers as well (along with some less than exceptional ones) -Relatively transparent internally for a trading firm -Compensation is reasonably good for the trading/hedge fund industry, and fantastic relative to most other industries -Excellent benefits -Management can be very agile, people will push to implement an idea quickly when it seems good -There's a sincere culture of charity and giving back -Not completely a meritocracy, but pretty meritocratic. If you make the company money you will get paid, up to a point.
cons: -Firing can be arbitrary or politically motivated -Amsterdam office priorities can conflict with Chicago office priorities, and Amsterdam always wins -Management can change priorities rapidly, feels disorganized at times -Bonuses are inherently political, and the distribution of the bonus pool is very skewed -Lots of turnover, most traders have been in their jobs for less than 3 years -Strategies are generally quite latency dependent and internal trading systems are both quite automated and quite idiosyncratic. Lots of what you learn here will not be useful anywhere else. Though this is beginning to change. -Changes to trading strategies/systems aren't always made in the most scientific way -Chicago office subsidizes bonus pools of other offices, particularly Amsterdam

years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time for more than 10 years
pros: Really gptw and has always been
cons: None That I can think of

years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time for less than a year
pros: Amazing company to work for! Competent managers and emphasis on technology and automation. Open and collaborative culture, with amazing benefits and perks. Great compensation, and awesome location inside the Willis Tower. Feedback-oriented culture is helpful for personal growth. I joined from another company in the industry, and it’s so much better here. Surrounded by the brightest minds in the industry. Traineeship is global, so you get to travel to Amsterdam and Sydney for training, all expenses paid. Amazing experience!
cons: There really aren’t any that come to mind.

years_at_company: I worked at IMC Trading full-time
pros: supported Management as well as work environment
cons: Must negotiate salary from the start.

years_at_company: I worked at IMC Trading full-time for more than 3 years
pros: Good entry level job for people with no prior industry knowledge
cons: Pure example of a company where the Peter principle applies a lot of long serving average employees tend to rise to their level of incompetence which in turn leads to a lot of good employees leaving. Also be aware of the fact that discretionary bonuses are often a synonym of arbitrary bonuses there.

years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time for less than a year
pros: Good pay, free lunch/breakfast/snacks/drinks, supportive work environment, great work/life balance, cool activities
cons: High expectations, but that's also kind of a plus.

years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time for more than a year
pros: I moved across the country to work at IMC and have been so grateful for that decision. - Incredibly intelligent co-workers that are willing to help with a positive attitude - Lots of opportunity to learn new things and grow in ability - Amazing benefits (health, dental, etc fully paid). Plus extras such as fun reimbursement, commute reimbursement, free breakfast/lunch. Happy hour every Friday. Yearly company trip, Christmas parties and more! - Awesome giving to the local community and world at large. Seriously they give back to a lot of great organizations and give you lots of chances to participate! - Constantly striving to improve you as an individual and themselves as a company. - No artificial schedules are deadlines. I have never seen a GANTT chart. You push yourself and work hard, if things don't got right you have the ability to try again. - Flexibility in work is great. Have a sick kid work from home that day. Most people do seem to work about 50 hours a week. - I have worked at many companies and IMC is hands down the best place I have ever worked.
cons: Really none. The company is very selective in who they hire, so getting in is the hardest part.

years_at_company: I have been working at IMC Trading full-time for more than a year
pros: Office in Sears Tower, insane pay and bonuses compared to other industries and still pretty high for a hedge fund/trading firm, outstanding culture, emphasis on philanthropy and giving back, leadership/personal development, low turnover, Trainee program in Amsterdam office, outstanding leadership, Friday office happy hours
cons: None yet. You get what you put in, both bonus and work-wise so if you're lazy, this isn't the place for you.
